Package frc.robot.subsystems

Class Chassis

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.SubsystemBase
      • frc.robot.subsystems.Chassis
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.Sendable, edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Subsystem
    public class Chassis
extends edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.SubsystemBase
    Chassis is the drivetrain subsystem of our bot. Our physical chassis is a swerve drive, so we use wpilib SwerveDriveKinematics and SwerveDrivePoseEstimator as opposed to Differential Drive objects

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected boolean useAprilTags
      Whether to update the odometry with the april tag or not.

      Chassis​(Limelight limelight)
      Makes a chassis that starts at 0, 0, 0

    • Field Detail

      • useAprilTags

        protected boolean useAprilTags
        Whether to update the odometry with the april tag or not. Usuallt used as a toggleable in auton commands. Default value is Constants.useAprilTags however is mutable.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Chassis

        public Chassis​(Limelight limelight)
        Makes a chassis that starts at 0, 0, 0
        Parameters:
        limelight - the limelight object that we can use for updating odometry

      • Chassis

        public Chassis​(edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose2d startingPos,
               edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Rotation2d startingRotation,
               Limelight limelight)
        Makes a chassis with a starting position
        Parameters:
        startingPos - the initial position to say that the robot is at
        startingRotation - the initial rotation of the bot
        limelight - the limelight object which is used for updating odometry

        public void resetOdometry​(edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose2d pose)
        Resets odometry

        Resets navx

        Resets relative encoders to be what the absolute encoders are

      • drive

        public void drive​(double x,
                  double y,
                  double theta,
                  boolean fieldRelative)
        The same as drive(double, double, double) except you pass in if you are field relative or not. This method will drive the swerve modules based to x, y and theta vectors.
        Parameters:
        x - velocity in the x dimension m/s
        y - velocity in the y dimension m/s
        theta - the angular (holonomic) speed to drive the swerve modules at
        fieldRelative - whether to use

      • drive

        public void drive​(double x,
                  double y,
                  double theta)
        Our main method to drive using three variables. Locked to field relative or robot oriented based off of fieldRelative.
        Parameters:
        x - the velocity in the x dimension m/s
        y - the velocity in the y dimension m/s
        theta - the angular (holonomic) speed of the bot

      • setAprilTagUsage

        public void setAprilTagUsage​(boolean useAprilTags)
        setter for april tags
        Parameters:
        useAprilTags - whether to use april tags or not
